title: Around the Districts : Ramsgrange to Tullogher - Rosbercon
body_text:
Around the Districts: Ramsgrange to Tullogher-Rosbercon
RAMSGRANGE
Notes contact details
We are always delighted to include items of local interest in the notes. Please email reception@swwfrc.ie before 4pm on the Friday evening prior to publication.
New Early Learning & Childcare Course
Following numerous requests, South West Wexford Family Resource Centre will be running an in-house QQI Level 5 Major award in Early Learning & Childcare. This course will be classroom led by a tutor. For more information contact Jane on 085 2569680. Limited spaces available.
Community employment positions at SWWFRC
South West Wexford FRC is currently seeking a Youth S
upport worker. This role will give you an opportunity to work with young people, helping them to develop essential life skills like communication, problem solving, decision making and leadership. To apply, or for more information, please contact 051 389418 or email Jane on cecoordinator@swwfrc.ie.
Sugradh Childcare Easter Camp at SWWFRC
Sugradh Childcare are holding their easter camp for the 2 weeks of easter. Week 1 – Mon 14th April – Thurs 17th April and Week 2 – Tue 22nd to 25th April (€50 per week/€15 per day) 9.30am to 1.30pm (Ages 3-9) Families can apply for National Childcare Scheme on mygov.ie for reduced rates. All children need to be fully toilet trained. To reserve a space please call SWWFRC on 051 389418 and as for Brenda/Jacqueline or email childcareadmin@wswwfrc.ie (online payments only).
Fusion Youth Café
The Youth Café will shortly be starting a “Healthy Choices” programme, which is all about empowering women to make healthy, informed choices about their lives. This will be an eight-week programme, beginning mid-March, on a day to be confirmed. It is suitable for 13- to 16-year-old girls and each session will run for two hours from 6-8pm. Topics covered will include food & nutrition, mindful movement, hormonal health, creative journalling, managing stress and much more. To book, or for more information, call Ann on 087 1769843.
LTI (Local Training Initiative) at SWWFRC
Don’t miss out on the opportunity to join us on our new course “Office Skills” which has just started. This course is free for anyone who would like to participate, and learners may be eligible for a training allowance. The programme is delivered locally in South West Wexford Family Resource Centre in Ramsgrange. It is a part-time and will run Monday to Thursday, from 9.30am to 2.30pm each day. Modules include Word processing, Customer service, Reception skills, Bookkeeping and Accounts. If you would like more information, please contact us at christina@swwfrc.ie, or sheila@swwfrc.ie or 0874552980/051 389418, or follow us on Facebook is https://www.facebook.com/LTISWWFRC/
Ramsgrange Horticultural Society
Our Horticultural Group meet every Thursday morning at 10.30am in the Society’s tunnel at the side of the Family Resource Centre (Y34 DP26) in Ramsgrange. We are a friendly, inclusive group and anyone interested in gardening would be very welcome to join us. For more information contact May on 087 9240330
Pottery classes at SWWFRC
We will shortly be holding 2 pottery workshops here at the Family Resource Centre in Ramsgrange. The first is on Wednesday 26th February and the second on Wednesday 5th March. Under the guidance of tutor Laura, in Session 1 you will get an opportunity to create your own piece, then let your creativity flourish in session 2 when you paint your masterpiece. These workshops are free, but spaces are limited. To book, call Jennie on 087 0985706 or email read@swwfrc.ie.
Ramsgrange Parish Office
The parish Office has a wide selection of cards in stock at the moment. These include St Patrick’s Day cards, Easter cards, sympathy cards and prayer cards and rosary sets. We also have St Patrick’s Day badges and 1st Holy Communion items. The Parish Office is open from 9am to 1pm, Monday–Friday.
Shielbaggan Field Day
“A Date for your Diary” The Shielbaggan Field Day will be held on Sunday 4th May from 12-3pm. Looking forward to seeing you all there.
Hook Rural Tourism AGM
The Hook Rural Tourism Annual General Meeting will be held on Wednesday 12th March at 7pm at SWWFRC, Ramsgrange, Y34 DP26. If you live or work on the Hook Peninsula, or are interested in the area’s unique history, heritage and landscape, then consider attending the AGM. Committee roles are available for those who would like to have direct involvement in the tourism sector in Wexford. For further information you can contact info@hooktourism.com or call 051 389496
Hook Pickleball
Would you like to take up a new sport? If so, come try out pickleball -the world’s fastest growing sport. It’s a fun, social and friendly. It’s played on a badminton sized court with an additional non-volley line. A smooth faced paddle is used to hit a perforated ball. Hook Pickleball plays in Fethard Hall from 2 to 3.30pm on Tuesdays, and in Ramsgrange Community School gym from 7 to 8.30pm on Thursdays, and Fridays 7 to 8pm. Beginners are always welcome, and all equipment is provided. Over 18’s, €5 per session. If interested, please contact Brendan on 087 2241147, or Esther on 085 7107108
Duncannon Village St. Patricks Day Parade
The Duncannon Village St. Patrick’s Day Parade is back. In Memory of the late Father John, it is starting at the Star of the Sea at 11am on 17th March. To book a float contact: 085 7800933/0864099557
Duncannon Football Club Easter Camp
Football Skills, Games and Fun at Duncannon Football Club – 15th & 16th April from 3pm to 6pm. Ages 6 to 14, boys and girls. To book, go to www.footballacademyofireland.com and click on camps.
Tintern Drama Group
Don’t miss the opportunity to see “It’s the real McCoy” presented by Tintern Drama Group. This hilarious tale of love, lies, and turf will be held in The Hall, Fethard on Sea for one night only on Saturday 1st March. The play starts at 8pm, admission is €10, and tickets are available in Fethard Post Office or by calling 087 7934830. All proceeds are in aid of Scoil Mhaodhóig Pitch Development Fund.
RATHNURE
Rathnure Community Development CLG
Our AGM was held at the end of January to review the accomplishments of 2024 and to set goals for 2025. We would like to extend our thanks to the community for engaging with Dr. Yvonne Byrne on our Five-year Development Plan.
We would like to extend our gratitude to our outgoing chairman, Pat Codd, for his valuable contributions and leadership during such a pivotal time in our group’s planning. We are pleased to announce that Barry Barron has been elected as our new Chairman for the upcoming year, and wish him the best in the role.
A Draft Report and Action Plan will be made available for community review and feedback at our Coffee Morning taking place after Mass on Sunday 2nd March in the John Kelly Memorial Hall. All are welcome to attend.
Please take the time to read and reflect on the Plan as it addresses key needs and opportunities identified during community workshops, stakeholder meetings, and Household and Youth Surveys carried out by the group throughout 2023 and 2024.
Fundraising - As we embark on the development of the Reflective Garden, we are excited about engaging the community in our fundraising efforts planned for this year.
Our first fundraising event will be a concert on 8th March at JKM Hall. Tickets €10 from Bridget on 086 072 9473. We look forward to your support!
ST LEONARDS
Lotto
There was no Jackpot winner and no match three winner in the Tintern Lotto draw last week. The numbers drawn were; 3, 14, 23, 26, this weeks Jackpot is €9,200 and this weeks match three winners will share €400. Tickets on sale in all local shops and pubs and from committee members. Draw takes place every Tuesday night at 9pm.
School enrolments
St Leonards NS is accepting enrolments for September 2025. If you wish to enrol your child for the school year 25/26 please collect an enrolment pack from the school or call Bridget on 051-562570 or email stleonardsns@gmail.com. Closing date for applications is this Friday February 28.
Car Boot Sale
The St Leonards Car Boot sale will return for 2025 on St Patrick’s Day March 17, weather permitting. Gates open at 7am. All the usual conditions apply.
St Louis Day Care
St Louis Day Care Centre, Ramsgrange would be delighted to see more people in South West Wexford avail of the services we offer.
Why not give yourself a day out to meet with friends, old and new, join in activities, or learn new ones, Bingo, Singing, Dancing, Art, Cards, but to name a few while enjoying delicious freshly prepared meals from our kitchen. Our Cook is here to assist with special dietary requirements. Our Nurse is on hand to deal with any minor medical issues.
The services provided include bus collection, laundry, bakery, GP clinic, chiropody, hairdressing, assisted showering, Meals on Wheels Monday to Friday. We like to think of St. Louis Day Care Centre as a home away from home where you will be warmly welcomed.
If you think you, or if you know anybody who would benefit from attending the Day Care please contact us on 051 389509 or email us at stlouisdaycarecentre@gmail.com
There are rooms for hire in St Louis Day Care Centre, day and evenings to include meeting room large and small and a fully equipped physio room. Contact 051-389509 for further information.
TULLOGHER-ROSBERCON
Speed Limit
It was very surprising to see the new road speed limit signs erected on the Mile Bush/Mullinavat road showing the higher limit of 80 kilometres/hour rather than the expected 60km/hour. The lower speed limit comes into play just before the Golf Club, so drivers beware from then on.
Confirmation
Next Saturday, 1st March is Confirmation Day in Rosbercon ay 11am. Donegal native, Bishop Niall Coll, will administer the Sacrament to the children of the parish assisted by Fr Dan Cavanagh. All will be hoping for a fine day on Saturday.
Senior Football
After being beaten by James Stephen’s in the first round of the Kilkenny/League Championship Tullogher in their next outing collected a valuable two points when beating O Loughlin’s by 1-9 to 1-3. Next up are Kilmoganny whom Tullogher face on their home pitch at Brownstown on Sunday next.
County Safeguarding
The Diocesan Designated Liaison Person is Ms Elish Higgins (085-8021633), email, dip@ossory.ie. Deputy Designated Liaison Person is Mr Cathal Cullen, (056-7752448), email, ddip@ossory.ie, or Mrs Rose Brophy (087-3314330), email, ddip@ossory.ie.
Our Local Representatives are Brid Vereker, Millbanks Grove and Anne O Sullivan, Ballykenna.
Should you be concerned that a child/young person may be at risk within a church run organisation or group you are encouraged to report your concern to any of the above named people.
St Joseph’s Athletic Club
The club will hold a Super Raffle on Thursday 27th February in aid of the Walking Track Development project. Tickets are €10 each or a book of 10 for €50 available from any committee member. Your kind support much appreciated.
